channel.title: Site to practice HTML...?
channel.description:
Does anyone know where i can get like a free website, where i can practice my HTML? i tried dynDNs but it logs onto my router -.-. Theres nothing i can do on my router related to that.
Im a complete noob at this website business, so my bad if i said anything misleading/wrong.
i would have the files on my desktop like in a folder and im guessing it would load from there, i would code regular stuff onto there and the site would be updated? am i correct? well if i am or not i need something along those lines, unfortunately i can't pay for a website, no money so yeah =\. im willing to learn html to the fullest, only need some help :(. Thanks in advance!

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

Practice HTML on Joolo.com or FreeWebs.com

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Wow…about 7 hours since I was last on. I’m surprised this thread hasn’t been locked.

Look…the moral of this argument is: Any editor you want to edit your page is fine, just don’t go calling other people’s preferred editors shit. If it gets the job done, use it.

None of us have anything to prove to people we are never going to meet in real life. Well…except for legit who seems to have the need to prove himself to every stranger and his mother. But I’m sure we can live with his enormous ego.

Read full topic

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

How many more times am I going to have to repeat myself?

I really don’t care what skills you have, because that doesn’t help me.

Read full topic

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

MastrChief:

Why can’t you deal with the fact that NP++ and DW aren’t comparable only because of a few extra little features (some of which don’t even teach you anything) that make it easier to design your page.

No, they aren’t comparable, because DW makes it easier to design your page. End of story. Why would you need NP++? You still haven’t given me any reason that NP++ better, which makes you the bigot, because you believe in it with no reason. Furthermore, you haven’t shown me any site you made, obviously because they are too shitty to display. And don’t go off trying to pass someone else’s as your own.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:

Why can’t you deal with the fact that NP++ and DW aren’t comparable only because of a few extra little features (some of which don’t even teach you anything) that make it easier to design your page.

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

MastrChief:

Its funny how you kept mentioning not other html editor can do better than DW awhile ago, but now you’re on about any html editor except NP++ is fine. Regular notepad can edit html, wordpad can edit html. You’re going to sit there and say that every html editor except NP++ is good?

Yes, I understand the implications. I thank you for taking the time to unnecessarily explain them.

MastrChief:

You’re suggesting here that DW is amazing, and that Notepad++ can’t rival all because DW has a few extra features that make web design as easy as eating dinner.

Why not make it easy as eating dinner?

Read full topic

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

Its funny how you kept mentioning not other html editor can do better than DW awhile ago, but now you’re on about any html editor except NP++ is fine. Regular notepad can edit html, wordpad can edit html. You’re going to sit there and say that every html editor except NP++ is good?

xxlegitxx:

DW hand-feeds jack shit. It makes it easier for pros to do what they do best instead of worrying about indenting your lines, uploading your php files to see if they achieved the desired result, spell checking, and validation. Challenge yourself by creating a good site, not using a prehistoric editor. Only one thing matters, and that’s the end result. I’d like you to show me a website you coded in Notepad that looks better than anything I do in Dreamweaver.

You’re suggesting here that DW is amazing, and that Notepad++ can’t rival all because DW has a few extra features that make web design as easy as eating dinner.

Read full topic

bigot A person who is religiously attached to a particular computer, language, operating system, editor, or other tool (see religious issues).

or

big·ot
–noun
a person who is utterly intolerant of any differing creed, belief, or opinion.

Yeah. You’re a total bigot. In fact, xxlegitxx is the literal meaning of the word bigot.

yawn…this topic blows…I’m gonna go to another forum.

item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

  1. Is this how you’re going to continue to ignore what we say? If you would actually read things, then you’d find that I have stated that you should actually look into it instead of just sitting here smiting it without a second thought.

  2. Go find a better way to insult me than to suggest I don’t know the meaning of the word.

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

3.65 kilos:

And I did not say Notepad was a WYSIWYG editor, I said “I do all my coding in regular notepad. WYSIWYG FTW…”.

Actually, you did: “It is if you want it to be.”

3.65 kilos:

I, in fact, have not said one thing about Dreamweaver with the exception of saying it’s “not all it’s cracked up to be” followed by a quote from Wikipedia.org.

And, as I said, that one thing you said was completely irrelevant.

MastrChief:

Yes, we all ruined this topic, but if the bigot hadn’t of commented the way he did, I’d be willing to bet this would have turned out differently.

Yes, I’m a bigot, yet you still can’t come up with a single reason why NP++ is better than DW.

Oh, and btw, learn what a bigot is.

Read full topic

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“3.65 kilos, post:56, topic:124495”]You see, your second-to-last statement above contains two errors.
One being that we are not pre-adolescent boys and two being, if I were from Moparscape, do you think I would be able to withhold an argument without resorting to a remark of the likes of “STFU GTFO” or “You fail at life”? I think not, sir.[/quote]

I believe you are on the brink of STFU GTFOing. Considering your last post: “Agreed.” And the post before it, which had no relevance to Dreamweaver. Like I said, those adept at web design do not even bother using design mode, rendering whatever Wikipedia said about it, useless. And keep in mind, you were the one who said Notepad was a WYSIWYG editor, inside joke or not. Your fallacious arguments solely revolve around me being biased (not true), me having no experience with Notepad++ (not true), and the fact that Dreamweaver ‘babies’ its users (also not true). Your positions are based on unsubstantial facts. Finally, I suggest you make a point-by-point rebuttal of my statements, because you are clearly trying to avoid some of my more conclusive points. Good day.

Read full topic

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

No, I’d rather make you feel like you won.

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:36, topic:124495”]Obviously you cannot give any specific examples of where DW force feeds you or where Notepad is better than DW, so I suggest you stop talking out of your ass and learn how to code sites.

When was the last time you scripted a site in PHP or any server-side language? From your knowledge of the interwebz, probably never. Are you going to click multiple times just to upload a file after you saved it? If saving time is equivalent to being babied, then I’d rather get babied than use that shitty prehistoric excuse for an editor.[/quote]

xxlegitxx:

Give some specific examples, moron, instead of just throwing fluff based on your own biased paradigm.

xxlegitxx:

I didn’t say Notepad++ users are assholes. I’m saying people who use both Notepad++ and Dreamweaver on a project are assholes. For not properly learning how to use Dreamweaver and for not useing DW solely.

Sounds like something I’d here from a Moparscapian.

Maybe I am biased, but who says you’re not?

Yea, we’re assholes because we don’t need the same treatment you do, brilliant.

xxlegitxx:

This is coming from two pre-adolescent boys who are fresh from Moparscape.

I don’t know about you, but I don’t waste my time on Moparscape. The community can really dumb you down, thats why I stopped visiting months ago.

Read full topic

item.title: Site to practice HTML...?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“MastrChief, post:47, topic:124495”]What have you gathered?

I’ve given it a 3 day go, and I found it to be unappealing.[/quote]

You have yet to name something specific. Unless you come up with one, there is no point in continuing your pathetic argument.

[quote=“3.65 kilos, post:48, topic:124495”]According to wikipedia, Dreamweaver isn’t all it’s cracked up to be.

I say everyone should just use regular text editors and save it with no formatting. If you have a problem with your code after using a regular text editor, then it is your own fault.[/quote]

I have yet to see an experienced web designer use the design function in Dreamweaver. And that is what is the source of your ‘problem’ with Dreamweaver. And either way, NP++ doesn’t even have a WYSIWYG function, so DW bests it in that respect also. And plus, all the sites I code in Dreamweaver are XHTML 1.1 compliant, and are cross-browser and cross-platform compatible.

Read full topic
